==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|こと|は|k2=ば|yomi=kun}}

===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=ことば|言|tr1=koto|t1=word|端|tr2=ha|t2=edge; beginning, end}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>  {{rendaku2|sort=ことば|ha|ba}}

The term {{m|ja|言|tr=koto}} was formerly the main term for {{m|en|word}} in Japanese.  This term is also [[cognate]] with {{m|ja|事|tr=koto||thing, fact, event}}.  The ''ha'' may have been added to differentiate from {{m|ja|事|tr=koto}}.

The {{m|ja|葉}} spelling is an example of {{ateji|sort=ことば}}.

{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ことば|acc=3|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Derived terms====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|合い言葉|あいことば}}, {{ja-r|合言葉|あいことば}}: a [[password]] or [[passphrase]] {{qualifier|spoken}}; a [[motto]] or [[slogan]]
* {{ja-r|東言葉|あずま ことば}}: any dialect of eastern Japan
* {{ja-r|遊ばせ言葉|あそばせ ことば}}: a [[polite]] mode of speaking, generally by women, that consists of suffixing verbs with the term {{m|ja|遊ばせ|tr=asobase|pos=the stem of the causative form ''asobaseru'' of verb {{m|ja|遊ぶ}} ''asobu'', “to play; to hang out”}}
* {{ja-r|遊び言葉|あそび ことば}}: a [[hesitation]] [[word]]
* {{ja-r|天地の詞|あめつち の ことば}}: an [[instructional]] [[pangram]] used in the early {{w|Heian period}}, predating the ''{{w|Iroha}}''
* {{ja-r|言葉遣い|ことばづかい}}: [[wording]], [[word]] [[use]]
